column2: The horde of marauders were chasing through the lake again, and behind them came the pike.
column3: The horde of marauders were chasing through the lake again, and behind them came the pike.

column2: These last did not go together, like the perch, in serried ranks at a furious hunting pace, but slunk along one by one from stone to stone, and from weedy clump to weedy clump.
column3: These last did not go together, like the perch, in serried ranks at a furious hunting pace, but slunk along one by one from stone to stone, and from weedy clump to weedy clump.

column2: Grim is with them, and like a seal she helps herself to the flying bleak which in their terror rush blindly into her jaws.
column3: Grim is with them, and like a seal she helps herself to the flying bleak which in their terror rush blindly into her jaws.

column2: It is quick work, but nevertheless not quick enough.
column3: It is quick work, but nevertheless not quick enough.

column2: The gluttony of the perch angers and irritates her; she feels her belly growing larger, and her throat widening.
column3: The gluttony of the perch angers and irritates her; she feels her belly growing larger, and her throat widening.

column2: She has room for more fish, mountains of fish!
column3: She has room for more fish, mountains of fish!

column2: With a jerk of her body she comes nearer, and is now right in the whirlpool of bleak and perch.
column3: With a jerk of her body she comes nearer, and is now right in the whirlpool of bleak and perch.

column2: Quivering and trembling, the little fish fly in all directions as she tears among them, and with strong beats of her tail to right and left pursues her victims.
column3: Quivering and trembling, the little fish fly in all directions as she tears among them, and with strong beats of her tail to right and left pursues her victims.

column2: Her eyes gleam, and her thin lips quiver with insatiable desire.
column3: Her eyes gleam, and her thin lips quiver with insatiable desire.

column2: A big, high-backed perch coolie makes a capture right in front of her. In his eagerness he makes such a commotion in the water that it looks as if it were full of thick, shining snakes.
column3: A big, high backed perch coolie makes a capture right in front of her. In his eagerness he makes such a commotion in the water that it looks as if it were full of thick, shining snakes.

column2: Snap!
column3: Snap!

column2: Snap!
column3: Snap!

column2: There goes a bleak right before her nose!
column3: There goes a bleak right before her nose!

column2: This is more than she can endure!
column3: This is more than she can endure!

column2: She dislikes this insolent lake-dog in a still greater degree than when, as a young pike, she stayed in the shelter of the creek.
column3: She dislikes this insolent lake dog in a still greater degree than when, as a young pike, she stayed in the shelter of the creek.

column2: His cunning and deceit, his ability to save himself and to get her into a scrape, has of late frequently irritated her.
column3: His cunning and deceit, his ability to save himself and to get her into a scrape, has of late frequently irritated her.

column2: A moment later, while she is in the middle of a spring, he happens to be pushed by his comrades right in front of her mouth.
column3: A moment later, while she is in the middle of a spring, he happens to be pushed by his comrades right in front of her mouth.

column2: Her jaws are already opened, and the water is streaming in like a mill-race; she sees the bleak-fat upon the mouth of her plump opponent, and her ferocity and murderous lust are doubled.
column3: Her jaws are already opened, and the water is streaming in like a mill race; she sees the bleak fat upon the mouth of her plump opponent, and her ferocity and murderous lust are doubled.

column2: Then she gives way to the innermost need of her being.
column3: Then she gives way to the innermost need of her being.

column2: With an enormous development of energy, intoxicated with the joy of capture, she attacks the Rasper with the full strength of both her serrated jaws, opening them so wide, and dashing at him with such force, that they engulf him to far down his plump hog-back.
column3: With an enormous development of energy, intoxicated with the joy of capture, she attacks the Rasper with the full strength of both her serrated jaws, opening them so wide, and dashing at him with such force, that they engulf him to far down his plump hog back.

column2: The hundreds of little teeth with which her palate is paved have the same desire, the same purpose; to bore right in and hold fast.
column3: The hundreds of little teeth with which her palate is paved have the same desire, the same purpose; to bore right in and hold fast.

column2: Just as the pike's attack is at its height, the Rasper suddenly raises his twelve-spined dorsal fin.
column3: Just as the pike's attack is at its height, the Rasper suddenly raises his twelve spined dorsal fin.

column2: During his chase of the little fish, it had lain neatly folded like a fan along his back; now it is transformed into a murderous weapon, and its bony ribs into a bundle of hidden sword-blades, now stiff and sharp like polished bayonets, now elastically pliable like rapiers.
column3: During his chase of the little fish, it had lain neatly folded like a fan along his back; now it is transformed into a murderous weapon, and its bony ribs into a bundle of hidden sword blades, now stiff and sharp like polished bayonets, now elastically pliable like rapiers.

column2: Joyfully Grim takes the big lump into her mouth.
column3: Joyfully Grim takes the big lump into her mouth.

column2: She feels that it pricks her, but the cavity of her mouth is not troubled with any exaggerated sensitiveness.
column3: She feels that it pricks her, but the cavity of her mouth is not troubled with any exaggerated sensitiveness.

column2: Splendidly heavy and solid the Rasper feels as he lies upon her tongue! And yet--his rough, tile-like scales, and the very small amount of fat and slime on his skin, make it unusually difficult for her to get the lump down.
column3: Splendidly heavy and solid the Rasper feels as he lies upon her tongue! And yet-his rough, tile like scales, and the very small amount of fat and slime on his skin, make it unusually difficult for her to get the lump down.

column2: He is hurting her now.
column3: He is hurting her now.

column2: She quickly takes a better hold, even letting her prehensile teeth come into play, and the long board-like tongue warp in co-operation; but no matter what she does, or how wide she opens her mouth, her efforts are in vain: the high-backed one refuses to move beyond a certain point.
column3: She quickly takes a better hold, even letting her prehensile teeth come into play, and the long board like tongue warp in co-operation; but no matter what she does, or how wide she opens her mouth, her efforts are in vain: the high backed one refuses to move beyond a certain point.

column2: Incomprehensible!
column3: Incomprehensible!

column2: Impossible!
column3: Impossible!

column2: She tries again.
column3: She tries again.

column2: Besides her tongue and her prehensile teeth, she brings the muscles of her throat into play, and the bones of her head expand like a snake's.
column3: Besides her tongue and her prehensile teeth, she brings the muscles of her throat into play, and the bones of her head expand like a snake's.

column2: Colours dance before her eyes as the gullet opens and closes, trying to draw in the perch's head.
column3: Colours dance before her eyes as the gullet opens and closes, trying to draw in the perch's head.

column2: But to no avail. The wedge remains immovable.
column3: But to no avail. The wedge remains immovable.

column2: The big mouthful is _too_ big!
column3: The big mouthful is underscore too underscore big!

column2: So there is nothing to be done, but give it up!
column3: So there is nothing to be done, but give it up!

column2: Grim opens her mouth wide, relaxes her prehensile teeth, which, as readily as an adder's, turning on their hinges, return to the perpendicular; she opens her throat-muscles as far as she can, and even pushes with her tongue. "There!
column3: Grim opens her mouth wide, relaxes her prehensile teeth, which, as readily as an adder's, turning on their hinges, return to the perpendicular; she opens her throat muscles as far as she can, and even pushes with her tongue. "There!

column2: The torture in the spiked barrel is over.
column3: The torture in the spiked barrel is over.

column2: The prison is graciously open to the great perch."
column3: The prison is graciously open to the great perch."

column2: The Rasper, who, all through the battle, has been lashing out with his strong tail, which is hanging out of the pike's mouth, and throwing Grim from one side to the other, suddenly notices the loosening of the strait-jacket, and backs with a jerk.
column3: The Rasper, who, all through the battle, has been lashing out with his strong tail, which is hanging out of the pike's mouth, and throwing Grim from one side to the other, suddenly notices the loosening of the strait jacket, and backs with a jerk.

column2: He thinks he is free, so easily does he swim now, although the darkness before his eyes is just as thick and oppressive.
column3: He thinks he is free, so easily does he swim now, although the darkness before his eyes is just as thick and oppressive.

column2: He is still in the pike's throat, and cannot get away, for he has his twelve stiffest dorsal spines bored into his enemy's palate; and the more he worries and works with his dangerous opponent, the deeper and more firmly do the spines fix themselves.
column3: He is still in the pike's throat, and cannot get away, for he has his twelve stiffest dorsal spines bored into his enemy's palate; and the more he worries and works with his dangerous opponent, the deeper and more firmly do the spines fix themselves.

column2: In the meantime Grim, true to her pike-nature, has for a few moments lost nearly all her energy.
column3: In the meantime Grim, true to her pike nature, has for a few moments lost nearly all her energy.

column2: The spines begin to hurt her, and her mouthful on the whole to incommode her.
column3: The spines begin to hurt her, and her mouthful on the whole to incommode her.

column2: She cannot get sufficient water over her gills, and what does filter into her mouth in spite of the gag, is needed by the gag itself.
column3: She cannot get sufficient water over her gills, and what does filter into her mouth in spite of the gag, is needed by the gag itself.

column2: She can feel it breathing inside her mouth; incessantly, with every indication of excitement, its gill-covers open and close, and take the lion's share of the water.
column3: She can feel it breathing inside her mouth; incessantly, with every indication of excitement, its gill covers open and close, and take the lion's share of the water.

column2: It is impossible for her to bear this suffocation any longer; she must have air; and in ungovernable rage she begins to lash out with her tail.
column3: It is impossible for her to bear this suffocation any longer; she must have air; and in ungovernable rage she begins to lash out with her tail.

column2: Now it is she who takes the upper hand, and pushes the hog-backed one before her through the water.
column3: Now it is she who takes the upper hand, and pushes the hog backed one before her through the water.

column2: Thus the combat continues.
column3: Thus the combat continues.

column2: Now it is Grim who has the mastery, and shakes her opponent so that the perch's tail slaps her weakly on the cheeks, and fetches her blow after blow upon the back of her neck.
column3: Now it is Grim who has the mastery, and shakes her opponent so that the perch's tail slaps her weakly on the cheeks, and fetches her blow after blow upon the back of her neck.

column2: Now it is the Rasper's turn to use Grim as a ferule, running her against stones and water-plants on the bottom, and whirling her round.
column3: Now it is the Rasper's turn to use Grim as a ferule, running her against stones and water plants on the bottom, and whirling her round.

column2: But no matter how much they exert themselves, it is without result; they do not succeed in getting away from one another.
column3: But no matter how much they exert themselves, it is without result; they do not succeed in getting away from one another.

column2: Faint and dead-beat, they fall over on their sides.
column3: Faint and dead beat, they fall over on their sides.

column2: The blood in their red gills scarcely circulates, their strength is ebbing, and there is no longer any question of either being _leader_.
column3: The blood in their red gills scarcely circulates, their strength is ebbing, and there is no longer any question of either being underscore leader underscore.

column2: They only take it in turns now to splash a little with their tails and try to right themselves.
column3: They only take it in turns now to splash a little with their tails and try to right themselves.

column2: Grim, who is lying with her gills outside in the free water, is still alive and in possession of all her senses, but the Rasper is half dead.
column3: Grim, who is lying with her gills outside in the free water, is still alive and in possession of all her senses, but the Rasper is half dead.

column2: Then they float up and drift over the surface of the water like dead fish.
column3: Then they float up and drift over the surface of the water like dead fish.

column2: Thunder is rolling over the lake.
column3: Thunder is rolling over the lake.

column2: A scorching sun and oppressive heat have long foreboded the storm that is brewing, and now at last it has burst; the clouds and the water have met.
column3: A scorching sun and oppressive heat have long foreboded the storm that is brewing, and now at last it has burst; the clouds and the water have met.

column2: The celestial salute begins rumbling and crackling a long way off in the farthest corner where the reed-forests rally round the mouth of the brook.
column3: The celestial salute begins rumbling and crackling a long way off in the farthest corner where the reed forests rally round the mouth of the brook.

column2: The lightning ploughs long, white-glowing fibrous sparks out of the sombre, purple horizon, from which the showers come chasing and sweeping over the lake, casting dark, threatening shadows before them.
column3: The lightning ploughs long, white glowing fibrous sparks out of the sombre, purple horizon, from which the showers come chasing and sweeping over the lake, casting dark, threatening shadows before them.

column2: Under the fringe of forest on the lee-side, where all the grebes have crept together, one of the "big birds" is lying at anchor.
column3: Under the fringe of forest on the lee side, where all the grebes have crept together, one of the "big birds" is lying at anchor.

column2: She is riding out the storm while the whirlwinds are playing touch over the deep water.
column3: She is riding out the storm while the whirlwinds are playing touch over the deep water.

column2: She has no lines or fishing-tackle out; she knows well that all angling is in vain.
column3: She has no lines or fishing tackle out; she knows well that all angling is in vain.

column2: The water seethes and boils on all sides; the grey troughs of the waves are full of bursting bubbles.
column3: The water seethes and boils on all sides; the grey troughs of the waves are full of bursting bubbles.

column2: Little slate-coloured showers dart about, and plough up the surface of the water like the scratching of a cat on the skin; they dash themselves against the reedy margin and the edge of the wood, cutting broad lanes through them.
column3: Little slate coloured showers dart about, and plough up the surface of the water like the scratching of a cat on the skin; they dash themselves against the reedy margin and the edge of the wood, cutting broad lanes through them.

column2: All the fish have left the shallow water for the depths where they can lie far enough below the surface to escape the movement of the waves. Only the sheat-fish, the old water-hyena, is out roaming.
column3: All the fish have left the shallow water for the depths where they can lie far enough below the surface to escape the movement of the waves. Only the sheat fish, the old water hyena, is out roaming.

column2: The wild weather puts life into Oa; it brings her great opportunities. The fish cannot see in the rough water, they are thrown out of their course, at one moment jumbled together, then separated; and one and another come to grief.
column3: The wild weather puts life into Oa; it brings her great opportunities. The fish cannot see in the rough water, they are thrown out of their course, at one moment jumbled together, then separated; and one and another come to grief.

column2: It is corpse-weather today.
column3: It is corpse weather today.

column2: The angry waves stir up carrion from the bottom, or carry it out from bridge and bank.
column3: The angry waves stir up carrion from the bottom, or carry it out from bridge and bank.

column2: She always gets so hungry in stormy weather, and feels as if she must go to the surface for air.
column3: She always gets so hungry in stormy weather, and feels as if she must go to the surface for air.

column2: Feeling her way with her sensitive barbels, she glides out of her hole on the east side of the submarine mountain slope.
column3: Feeling her way with her sensitive barbels, she glides out of her hole on the east side of the submarine mountain slope.

column2: Like a huge eel she wriggles up to the surface, where she lies in wait, slowly drifting with the current.
column3: Like a huge eel she wriggles up to the surface, where she lies in wait, slowly drifting with the current.

column2: Grim's white belly is not turned down now.
column3: Grim's white belly is not turned down now.

column2: The colour that makes the fish look one with the water would then have hidden her well enough for any one looking up from below.
column3: The colour that makes the fish look one with the water would then have hidden her well enough for any one looking up from below.

column2: Now her flecked sides and black back make a distinct stripe in the water.
column3: Now her flecked sides and black back make a distinct stripe in the water.

column2: A cunning expression comes into Oa's little eyes.
column3: A cunning expression comes into Oa's little eyes.

column2: The queer fish with two tails attracts her.
column3: The queer fish with two tails attracts her.

column2: The storm is abating; the last heavy shower is over.
column3: The storm is abating; the last heavy shower is over.

column2: A patch of blue sky peeps out like a smiling eye between the frayed, swollen clouds. The lake sinks to rest, and even the pennons of the rushes hang loosely from their stalks; but in the distance can be heard the low rumbling of another storm.
column3: A patch of blue sky peeps out like a smiling eye between the frayed, swollen clouds. The lake sinks to rest, and even the pennons of the rushes hang loosely from their stalks; but in the distance can be heard the low rumbling of another storm.

column2: The boat takes advantage of the lull, and is on her way home.
column3: The boat takes advantage of the lull, and is on her way home.

column2: Oa, hearing the swish of her bow, has only time to make a few hasty snaps at the big perch's already swollen belly; her thick, fleshy lips are still pulling at the Rasper's intestines as she slowly dives down into deep water.
column3: Oa, hearing the swish of her bow, has only time to make a few hasty snaps at the big perch's already swollen belly; her thick, fleshy lips are still pulling at the Rasper's intestines as she slowly dives down into deep water.

column2: The gulls and terns, which have begun to gather about the spot, are filled with renewed hope, and swoop down upon their prey with vociferous cries.
column3: The gulls and terns, which have begun to gather about the spot, are filled with renewed hope, and swoop down upon their prey with vociferous cries.

column2: Involuntarily the angler's attention is attracted to them.
column3: Involuntarily the angler's attention is attracted to them.

column2: He takes out his glasses, then rows nearer; and in another moment he has the two fish in his landing-net.
column3: He takes out his glasses, then rows nearer; and in another moment he has the two fish in his landing net.

column2: What a haul!
column3: What a haul!

column2: A pike that has gorged itself on a giant perch!
column3: A pike that has gorged itself on a giant perch!

column2: And it can only just have happened, for as soon as he has them in the boat he puts his nose to them and smells that they are fresh.
column3: And it can only just have happened, for as soon as he has them in the boat he puts his nose to them and smells that they are fresh.

column2: The perch, it is true, looks rather poorly, but that is probably because the gulls have been at him already; and he carefully begins to release it, and is greatly pleased when he discovers that the big, voracious pike, which is quite lively, is one of his marked fish.
column3: The perch, it is true, looks rather poorly, but that is probably because the gulls have been at him already; and he carefully begins to release it, and is greatly pleased when he discovers that the big, voracious pike, which is quite lively, is one of his marked fish.

column2: Grim is furious, and tries to bite and snap while the happy angler makes a guess at her weight by swinging the landing-net up and down in his hands.
column3: Grim is furious, and tries to bite and snap while the happy angler makes a guess at her weight by swinging the landing net up and down in his hands.

column2: Ten pounds at the very lowest!
column3: Ten pounds at the very lowest!

column2: No throwing this one back again!
column3: No throwing this one back again!

column2: So she was once more in man's power, between his fingers and nails.
column3: So she was once more in man's power, between his fingers and nails.

column2: The light made her eyes prick and smart, the dry air stopped the course of her blood and her scales rose in terror and pain.
column3: The light made her eyes prick and smart, the dry air stopped the course of her blood and her scales rose in terror and pain.

column2: For the third time she was as it were in the heron's throat!
column3: For the third time she was as it were in the heron's throat!

column2: Then at last she awoke, her sight returned and the breath to her red gills; her brain became clear, and she no longer felt that uncomfortable pressure on the back of her neck.
column3: Then at last she awoke, her sight returned and the breath to her red gills; her brain became clear, and she no longer felt that uncomfortable pressure on the back of her neck.

column2: Life was once more coursing through her veins.
column3: Life was once more coursing through her veins.

column2: She was in water, and with a stroke of her tail she made for the bottom.
column3: She was in water, and with a stroke of her tail she made for the bottom.

column2: Oh!
column3: Oh!

column2: She had run her nose against a "stone!" She turned away and tried to go to one side, but there was another stone; there were stones all round her.
column3: She had run her nose against a "stone!" She turned away and tried to go to one side, but there was another stone; there were stones all round her.

column2: The fisherman had put her into the well of his boat.
column3: The fisherman had put her into the well of his boat.

column2: She would be all right there--for the present!
column3: She would be all right there-for the present!

column2: The well was full of small fish, which at her appearance immediately crowded together in a corner.
column3: The well was full of small fish, which at her appearance immediately crowded together in a corner.

column2: She scowled at them, but although her stomach was empty, she felt no desire to eat.
column3: She scowled at them, but although her stomach was empty, she felt no desire to eat.

column2: She remained perfectly still in the darkest corner of the well, and took note in her own way of what went on around her--the angler's tread on the planks of the boat, his rattling with the oars and gear, his shouts and hailing of other sportsmen gliding past, fastened themselves in her memory.
column3: She remained perfectly still in the darkest corner of the well, and took note in her own way of what went on around her-the angler's tread on the planks of the boat, his rattling with the oars and gear, his shouts and hailing of other sportsmen gliding past, fastened themselves in her memory.

column2: Now and again a "bushy plant" came down and waved its stalks and leaves about her head.
column3: Now and again a "bushy plant" came down and waved its stalks and leaves about her head.

column2: She wanted to get away from the bush, and started with a stroke of her tail, but she ran straight into the landing-net.
column3: She wanted to get away from the bush, and started with a stroke of her tail, but she ran straight into the landing net.

column2: She could not tear the bushy plant, its numerous thick tendrils were so absurdly strong; and it increased her suspicion and gave her fresh experience.
column3: She could not tear the bushy plant, its numerous thick tendrils were so absurdly strong; and it increased her suspicion and gave her fresh experience.

column2: Deep down, Oa follows the boat and listens to the ripple of the water against the keeled breast of the great "swimming bird." The old hyena, who had fed on the carrion of the lake for more than fifty years, knew all about the fishermen.
column3: Deep down, Oa follows the boat and listens to the ripple of the water against the keeled breast of the great "swimming bird." The old hyena, who had fed on the carrion of the lake for more than fifty years, knew all about the fishermen.

column2: With her little blinking, bronze-coloured eyes, that lay floating at the sides of her head, right out where the nostrils are generally placed in mammals, she gives careful attention to the refuse that the fisherman throws out when he cleans the dead perch.
column3: With her little blinking, bronze coloured eyes, that lay floating at the sides of her head, right out where the nostrils are generally placed in mammals, she gives careful attention to the refuse that the fisherman throws out when he cleans the dead perch.

column2: She dares not venture up to the surface.
column3: She dares not venture up to the surface.

column2: The sun is shining again, and there is no archipelago of water-lily leaves under which she can hide her head.
column3: The sun is shining again, and there is no archipelago of water lily leaves under which she can hide her head.

column2: She must wait patiently until her perquisites descend.
column3: She must wait patiently until her perquisites descend.

column2: She also hears the splashing of the bird, and shouts and strange thumps on the boat-planks; and she keeps her blue-black pupils fixed expectantly upon the great dark shadow up there.
column3: She also hears the splashing of the bird, and shouts and strange thumps on the boat planks; and she keeps her blue black pupils fixed expectantly upon the great dark shadow up there.

column2: Who knows, some day perhaps a young one might drop out!
column3: Who knows, some day perhaps a young one might drop out!

column2: As the angler neared the shore he lifted the lid of the well, and stood rejoicing over his catch.
column3: As the angler neared the shore he lifted the lid of the well, and stood rejoicing over his catch.

column2: He saw the pike throw up her head, and was glad to find her still as lively as ever.
column3: He saw the pike throw up her head, and was glad to find her still as lively as ever.

column2: And to think that Heaven should at last reward him for his magnanimity! For the mark on the dorsal fin showed distinctly that this fish had been in his hands before.
column3: And to think that Heaven should at last reward him for his magnanimity! For the mark on the dorsal fin showed distinctly that this fish had been in his hands before.

column2: Grim saw glimpses of the open water from which the dark land-shadows, in the form of the sides of the boat, shut her off.
column3: Grim saw glimpses of the open water from which the dark land shadows, in the form of the sides of the boat, shut her off.

column2: It must be a ditch she had got into, a pool; such mishaps had befallen her before on her annual wedding-tours up in narrow channels and bogs.
column3: It must be a ditch she had got into, a pool; such mishaps had befallen her before on her annual wedding tours up in narrow channels and bogs.

column2: Well then, she knew what to do, and she crouched in a corner, where she lay awaiting her opportunity.
column3: Well then, she knew what to do, and she crouched in a corner, where she lay awaiting her opportunity.

column2: The angler should have replaced the lid before taking his usual nip.
column3: The angler should have replaced the lid before taking his usual nip.

column2: As it was, he was standing quietly leaning back with crooked arm, when suddenly, with a tremendous leap, Grim sprang out of the well and over the side of the boat, and with a splash disappeared into the lake.
column3: As it was, he was standing quietly leaning back with crooked arm, when suddenly, with a tremendous leap, Grim sprang out of the well and over the side of the boat, and with a splash disappeared into the lake.

column2: Funny thing, very funny! said a traveller a little later in the railway-carriage, to whom the angler had wrathfully related his story.
column3: Funny thing, very funny! said a traveller a little later in the railway carriage, to whom the angler had wrathfully related his story.
